Ethan Alexander García Baker

student/scientist/ philosopher/ bioinformatician/ adventurer/TBD. In training. B.Phil. Candidate, University of Pittsburgh.

Email Twitter Facebook LinkedIn Github

Hello.

I am a third-year undergraduate student at the University of Pittsburgh. I am a Bachelor of Philosophy candidate in the Department of Neuroscience, concentrating on computational biology and neuroinformatics. I’m also pursuing a Bachelor of the Arts in History and Philosophy of Science.

I’ll be looking for a PhD position in computational genomics and bioinformatics later on this year. My CV is below (also here).


Currently, I am a research intern in the Gerstein Lab at Yale University, where I am working on peak calling in massively parallel regulatory assays to identify ehnancers as part of the Gerstein Lab’s contribution to ENCODE.


Previously, I was the William Shakespeare Fellow at Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory where I worked with the McCombie Lab to improve NGS sequencing pipelines and develop in-silico simulation software for generation of PacBio long read data.


Other current projects include development of computational models of neural circuits implicated in autonomic regulation with the Yates Lab at the University of Pittsburgh. Some past projects include a comparative transcriptomic analysis of the white pines with the Computational Genomics Laboratory at the University of Connecticut.


My CV is available here
